授業目的: シェイクスピア劇の舞台上演等の翻案は過去30年にわたり批評的な議論を起こした新しい研究分野となっている。本科目は、2000年以降と明治時代の日本語翻案を取り上げ、履修者がシェイクスピア劇の現代翻案論を学ぶ。
到達目標: 履修者はシェイクスピア劇の翻案研究に役立つ有益な方法を身につける。
授業方法: Reading, viewing and discussion in English.

第1回: course introduction: chronology of Shakespeare adaptation in Japan
第5回: guest lecture: Shakespearean drama and kyogen adaptation (TBC)
第6回: study text of Kawai Shoichiro's adaptation of 'Richard III', 'Kuni nusubito' (2007)
第8回: watch video of Nomura Mansai's production of 'Kunu nusubito' (2007) on Asian Shakespeare Intercultural Archive
第9回: reading on Shakespeare and intercultural adaptation (Hamana Emi, 2011)
第10回: reading on Shakespeare and intercultural adaptation (2)
第11回: watch video of Ku'Nauka production of 'Mugen-Noh Othello' (2005) on Asian Shakespeare Intercultural Archive
第12回: study text of Tsubouchi Shoyo's joruri adaptation of 'Julius Caesar', 'Jiyu no tachi nagori no kireaji' (1884)
第13回: study text of 'Jiyu no tachi nagori no kireaji' (2)
第14回: closing: reading on 'Jiyu no tachi nagori no kireaji' (Aragorn Quinn, 2011)
トピック.授業外学習2: Students are expected to prepare weekly readings ahead of class, and to plan and research the final essay to a high academic standard.

備考　Note
Students will research and write an essay of between 2,000 and 3,000 words on any topic of interest to them within the field of Shakespeare adaptation. Having decided on a topic in early December, students should submit their essay by an agreed deadline in January. The essay should be written in English.
